metadata.title: DPM Ishaq Dar grieved over loss of lives, property in China earthquake

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jan 7 (APP): Deputy Prime Minister Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Tuesday expressed deep grief and sorrow over the loss of precious lives and property caused by the devastating earthquake in China. aWe are deeply saddened by the devastating earthquake that struck the Tibet Autonomous Region this morning,a the deputy PM said in his social media post on X. He said aOur thoughts and prayers are with the victims, their families, and all those affected by this tragedya. Ishaq Dar prayed for strength and comfort to those affected by the earthquake. aWe stand in solidarity with the people of China and offer our sincerest condolences,a the deputy PM added. Ishtiaq Ahmed, APPas Foreign Editor, leads coverage of the Prime Minister, President and Foreign Office, bringing over 20 years of journalism experience from local and international publications a Reach out at 03335293238/ ishtiaqrao@gmail.com/ X: ishtiaqrao
content.summary: Deputy Prime Minister Mohammad Ishaq Dar expressed deep grief and sorrow over the loss of lives and property caused by the devastating earthquake in China.
